page.title: 01Swindon in 1985
page.content: Swindon grew up as a railway town when Brunel chose it as the centre for the Great Western Railway, locomotive, carriage building and repair workshops in 1841. The town became dependant on these workshops as the main source of employment. In recent years,with the decline of the railways, the town has set out to attract a variety of firms to give it a broader industrial base. The new industrial estates and office blocks have changed the skyline.Many people have come to liveand work here,helping it to become one of Europe's fastest expanding towns in the 1980's. It has pleasant chalk downs to the south and a lowlying clay vale to the north, a thriving soccer club, new sports complexes, and a good shopping centre.
